ratings.comment: Professor Roberts was decent. Unfortunately you are told at the beginning of the class to buy countless books that you'll need to read which gets expensive. What you soon learn is there is no need to buy these books, and even less incentive to listen to lecture. Fairly interesting class, however was a bit disappointing in regard to WW2 history.

Great lady, really a pleasure in office hours. But, first half of lectures were "discussions" about readings that did not relate to lecture content. This doesn't make sense because there was a dedicated discussion section once a week. This course had some good moments, but lacked clear focus and direction and I found it dissappointing.

Professor Roberts is clearly passionate about the topic and gave some great insight on the women involved in WWII. The class is heavily based on reading. Your entire grade is based on 5 short reading responses, a presentation, and a final paper. She is a fair grader and offers a lot of feedback. Besides that, she is a really sweet, genuine woman!

Professor Roberts is an AMAZING LECTURER, one of the BEST professors here at UW. Although there are many readings (usually a book a week) if you attend lectures and discussions you will do fine on papers and exams. For exams, don't sweat about the details in this class, as Roberts only test you on main/key ideas.

Professor Roberts was an amazing teacher to have the first semester of my freshman year. Her lectures were full of passion with plenty of visuals. However, there is a lot of reading to do, but all of it is necessary for the midterm and final

This class was really interesting and I'm glad I took it, but the reading load is very high and this is not an easy A. Roberts is a GREAT lecturer, emphasizing human nature's evolution. Tests are Literary Analysis essays on weekly novels read outside of lecture, which provides historical context for the readings. I highly recommend to non-freshman.

Very effective teacher. She structures her class so its not just 75 min of straight lecture, rather using the first 30 min as a discussion w/ students on the assigned readings and movies (yes, movies for hw). It helps her get to know you as students, helps you learn the readings if you didn't do it, and makes class more interesting & interactive.
Awesome professor who is clearly passionate about what she teaches. Big reading list, but a lot of it is lighter and fairly interesting

Took her WWII class. I did not like her lectures. The first half hour of every class was spent discussing either films or books, but there was a mandatory discussion section each week where we'd do it again. Reading list was ridiculous. Actual lecture content was often cut-and-dry, not very compelling stuff. The course also seemed to lack focus.

Best prof. I have ever had. She really changed my life and helped me figure out what to do post-grad. As a sr. I can easily say she is one of the best people I have come across on the UW campus. She makes you read a lot but it is worth it for everything you learn. Discussion time clears up readings too. She's a real inspiration, TAKE HER CLASS.
She is an amazing lecturer! She provides an outline before class, which makes her complex lectures easier to follow. Very knowledgable and passionate about her work.

Probably my favorite lecturer so far at Madison. There is a lot of assigned reading but she makes sense of it. The tests are easy, and the subject matter is basically french revolution forward which is interesting. She likes to talk about sex.

Lectures are very interesting.  She goes over a lot of information in short period of time, but it is not essential to memorize every word she says.  The grade for the most part places emphasis on common themes.  The class is very interesting.  I would highly recommend if you love history.  Papers aren't bad.  ALOT OF READING.

Professor Roberts is brilliant. I truly enjoyed this class and learned a lot. Declared my history major because of her. Lectures are engaging and grades are fair. As long as you go to lecture and do the reading, you will have no problem with the assignments. Be prepared to look at history in a new way.

Absolutely loved this class. My favorite class that I have taken here at the University. She is really passionate about WWII and shows it through her lectures. I would recommend this class to everyone, even people not interested in history.

Prof. Roberts is awesome! She's funny and candid and knows her stuff. Only critiques would be (1) way too much reading and movie watching (I have other classes to worry about) and (2) she doesn't let people ask questions during lecture, which would help clarify confusing material. Otherwise, amazing class. I learned so much!

One of my favorite history classes. She does the class in a smaller lecture hall and has class discussions every lecture, which is a nice change of pace. My only criticism is that there was a lot of reading, even for a history class. But all the books were great.
Great teacher.
Great Prof, LOVE HER!! She knows her stuff and makes it really easy and fun to learn!

Thought I would hate her right away, but ended up loving her. Truly one of the best lecturers at UW. Her WWI lecture was something I'll remember forever. Very reading intensive, but if you go to her lectures, you'll do fine on the tests.  Don't worry about dates or people, focus more on general themes/concepts. Take her if you have the opportunity!

She is an amazing lecturer and prof. If you are at all interested in history I would highly recommend this class. Lots of reading but you can get away without doing some of it. Two papers, a midterm and a final, none were overly challenging. Go to lecture or you will be completely lost but attendance is not mandatory.

One of the best Prof. I've had.  Her lecture on WWI was probably the best lecture I've ever had. Some of the readings are more interesting that others but overall not that bad. I highly recommend this class and Prof.

To me this was an English class rather than history. Excessive amount of reading. She focuses on very few tangible topics such as wars, economics and politics. Instead she talks about the mood and themes of writers and philosophers of the time. Found it troubling when whole time periods were explained by her through only one or two author's view

To me this was an English class rather than history. Excessive amount of reading. She focuses on very few tangible topics such as wars, economics and politics. Instead she talks about the mood and themes of writers and philosophers of the time. Found it troubling when whole time periods were explained by her through only one or two author's opinon
Best class and best prof at UW! Take this class if you can! There is a LOT of reading but it's very interesting and you watch lots of movies too.

She is an amazing professor. I was never interested in history before but she is just so passionate and makes the lectures interesting and relatable so it's hard to find yourself not liking it. She didn't take attendence in lecture but theres a very linear relationship in going to class and doing well in it! She is fun to talk to and is welcoming

Awesome professor, awesome class. It's a social history class, focused on the people affected by WWII (not military strategy, etc.) Watched movies and read novels for homework - fun and interesting. Professor Roberts rocks!

Prof Roberts teaches more thematically rather than strictly chronologically. Fun and interesting lecturer. Lots of reading and rather harsh grading for a 100 level class, but still highly recommended.

Prof. Roberts is an AMAZING teacher. Not many people enjoy history, but History 120 is actually a very interesting class and she makes it 10 times better. You need to come to lecture in order to get notes, but she sends outlines to each lecture the day before which makes it very easy to follow what she is talking abut. I recommend this class!

Eh. Shmeh, shmeh. I thought this class was extremely vague -- the French Revolution: I know that it's important now. There are some great books, some great lectures and then the other 60% is boring. The readings are more intense than the material allows you to dig. The papers suck to write because the topics want you to really stretch.

Shes a really good lecturer, and keeps things interesting. The outlines she prepares for every lecture make taking notes much easier. However, there's a lot of reading necessary and the class is graded pretty harsh, especially for a 100 level course

Absolutely the best class I've taken in the UW. Professor Roberts is very funny and the material is very interesting. Go to lecture, the notes are very helpful, do the readings since they're interesting anyway they won't be a drag, and you'll do well in the class!

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Lectures are necessary, but they are so interesting that I found myself actually wanting to go! The books were really interesting as well. She didn't teach from a textbook, but instead had us read books that everyone has heard of but few people actually read. Take any class she teaches!

Amazing Professor, Amazing Class!! Can't talk about it enough. Liked how we read novels instead of from a textbook.  I'm usually a dates and numbers type of person, but I loved this different type of class.

Prof. Roberts is awesome.  She follows course themes VERY closely and leaves some things out.  You never need to know exact dates and the midterm/final is all about understanding how the course themes fit together into the bigger picture.  You also get to talk about sex every friday lecture.
Awesome class, professor roberts is an amazing teacher that truly loves the material she teaches. Lecture is always very interesting and I learned a lot. Overall a great class, take it!

Prof. Roberts is a good prefessor. She sends out an outline of the next day's lecture every night and she really cares about students. I didn't like her obsession with France, but otherwise a good prof.

I love Prof Roberts! She is the best professor I have had over 4 years of college. She picks classic books with snob appeal. She is extremely intelligent, insightful, and emotional. It shows during her lectures, from start to finish. Take any class she offers.

By far the BEST professor I have ever had at UW.  She is the best lecturer I have ever had.  Although she may go a little bit fast in some lectures, I enjoyed listening and learning from her.  If you take good notes, you will never put your pen down.  Midterm and Final are straight forward.  The only problem to worry about are the TA's. She's GREAT

I wasn't expecting this type of history. I love European History so I thought this would be a lot of fun. It turns out that it's not about what happened and when but why. It was very conceptual and tore the history apart to analyze it. Prof. Roberts is amazing though -VERY enthusiastic; I love her! If tearing apart history is your thing, TAKE IT!

She is very interesting and helpful. I don't really like history and was worried it would be a dull and boring class, but ended up being really great and kept my interest during every lecture due to Robert's engaging passion and personality. Take this class!
Not normal History Class. You won't learn the numbers and dates but you come out knowing some cool things. A LOT OF WORK!!!

My TA Brian Covey was such a nice guy and really helpful. There were two papers, one midterm and one final. The exams were really fair and if you attend lecture there is no problem why you wouldn't get an A. The papers need more work and slightly more challenging but Prof Roberts's lectures are so fascinating and fun, I loved this class so much!-
INCREDIBLE!! she is amazing. you won't regret it. she is very articulate and inspiring!!

Lou Roberts is the new mesias! Take her! She's an awesome lecturer, a wonderful and understanding person and this is a great class. I'm a senior and this is one of the best professors i've had here + this class is really interesting, no matter what your major is.
Professor Roberts was one of the most passionate professors i have ever had. Her lectures were always interesting. Readings and tests were not bad. I highly recommend her.

I loved going to lectures but I found the paper topics and essay to be rather difficult, and we had to read alot (although any reading is alot of reading for an engineering major) I worked hard for a B, but I learned a lot, and the class was fun. Also, my TA was great, and supposedly all of the TA's were, but I suppose there are no guarantees.

im not a hist major, but i thoroughly enjoyed this class. emphasis on culture not politics, and integrates some advanced concepts into an elementary class without being overwhelming. dresses like a doll! go to lec, read the readings, review some--get an A. talk to her,too--she is a smart lady.

Great teacher, interesting material. Lectures are easy to follow and she makes everything relevent. Always willing to meet outside of class, and genuinely enthusiastic about material. She made me love history!

awesome class.  i was actually mad when i skipped.  the readings were mostly fun, and lecture cleared anything that could possibly be unclear.  if you do the minimal reading and show up to lecture you will get an A.  essay midterm and final questions given before test.
Professor is wonderful! amazing book list. she emails outlines before every lecture that she covers very well in class, and are helpful during lectures. overall excellent professor!

very passionate, very good lectures. there is a good amount of reading, but not that bad at all. uses novels or short readings rather than testbooks. lectures are interesting and the classroom was always full. everyone wanted to go to lecture.
it's an ok class. she's an ok professor.
i like the use of art and novels instead of textbooks, that wins serious points right there.
Great professor, keeps your interest the entire class (very useful when its a power lecture). Definitely would recommend his course
No Comments

Great lecturer!  Uses art and music as an aid for teaching about the culture of the times.  Assigns literature books instead of a history book (which is SO cool!), and she obviously loves what she does.  I'd definitely take a class with her again!
One of few professors that won't put you to sleep. Very helpful, very intelligent, very good.

Professor Roberts is a wonderful professor. She clearly has a passion for her job, and is without a doubt the most accessible professor I have met on this campus. Take one of her classes and get to know her! It will be to your benefit!

Prof. Roberts is a wonderful educator. She makes the class interesting with slides and music, she provides outlines for each class and is always willing to help you with anything! take any class she offers!

Professor Roberts gives amazing lectures and has a passion for the subject she is teaching.  She is willing to meet with students outside of class and wants everyone to succeed.  Take a class with her!!
